column4: Well ive been watching this channel from the shadows, is there a place to discuss the quality of the support community?
Anyway, I would like some help. My box seems to have a few bugs in it.
Dose anyone , perhaps know how to upgrade a distrobution without the terminal command for it?
Its not giving me the option  to upgrade my Lucid.
I wish to be operating a 10.10, Maverick box. But it is always telling me there is no upgrade. Is anyone able to help me?
Um, can you all hear me? Or am i muted or somthing. I seem to be getting ignored.
i can!
I fixed that today :D
Lemme guess, you cant boot into your Ubuntu anymore? It just goes right to windows?
Anyway, would a kind person like to help me with my upgrading problem?
If you look in the software sources preferences in software centre, is it set to update to regular or LTS release only?
Ill check, give me a second :)
that may have done it ! :) so i just run the dist-upgrade command
am i correct?
Just start update manager, and update it.
Is there a way to do it from the terminal. I find the GUI very cumbersome.
Nevermind, i wont be picky haha, im getting help. I should be grateful a nice man like yourself is helping me at all.
There is a do-release-upgrade/update iirc
Hmm, my system cannot get an exclusive lock even tho im not running anything else, i will try a reboot and then try again.
close all things related to package management first
